what: ArchaeoCal: An R Interface to 'OxCal' — ArchaeoCal-package
title: ArchaeoCal: An R Interface to 'OxCal' — ArchaeoCal-package
ArchaeoCal: An R Interface to 'OxCal' — ArchaeoCal-package
text: Full list authors contributors (alphabetic order) Package maintainer Nicolas Frerebeaunicolas.frerebeau@u-bordeaux-montaigne.fr Archéosciences Bordeaux (UMR 6034) Maison de l'Archéologie Université Bordeaux Montaigne 33607 Pessac cedex France

title: OxCal Output — OxCalOutput-class
text: ocd list OxCal data holds ranges, probability distributions, etc. parameter. model list information model. calib list information calibration curve.

title: OxCal Output — OxCalOutput-class
text: code snippets , x OxCalOutput object. .data.frame(x) Coerces data.frame.

title: 14C Calibration with OxCal — oxcal_calibrate
text: names character vector specifying names dates (e.g. laboratory codes). dates numeric vector giving BP dates calibrated. errors numeric vector giving standard deviation dates calibrated. curve character string specifying calibration curve used.

title: 14C Calibration with OxCal — oxcal_calibrate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Calibrate 14C dates cal <- oxcal_calibrate(   names = c("X","Y"),   dates = c(5000, 4500),   errors = c(45, 35) )  plot(cal) } # }

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
code: oxcal_configure(   command = NULL,   os = NULL,   ask = TRUE,   install_location = NULL,   install_url = NULL,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose") )

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: command character string specifying path OxCal directory. os character string specifying operating system workstation. must one "Linux", "Windows" "Darwin". NULL (default), operating system determined automatically (see Sys.info()). ask logical scalar: OxCal installed, user asked download ? FALSE R used interactively, raise error OxCal executable found. FALSE R used interactively, try download OxCal. install_location character string specifying directory extract OxCal files . created necessary (see utils::unzip()). install_url character string specifying url OxCal installed. verbose logical scalar: status updates displayed?

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: Downloads latest version Oxcal (needed) sets executable path correctly.

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  plot(res) plot(res, likelihood = TRUE, posterior = FALSE) plot(res, likelihood = FALSE, posterior = TRUE) } # }

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
code: oxcal_execute(   script,   file = NULL,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose"),   ... )

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
text: script character string instructions OxCal. file character string naming file (without extension) write script . Output files named file written directory. verbose logical scalar: status updates displayed? ... parameters passed system2().

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
text: list following elements: oxcal character string giving path .oxcal file. js character string giving path .js file. log character string giving path .log file. txt character string giving path .txt file. csv character string giving path .csv file.

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  plot(res) plot(res, likelihood = TRUE, posterior = FALSE) plot(res, likelihood = FALSE, posterior = TRUE) } # }

title: Download OxCal — oxcal_install
code: oxcal_install(   install_url = NULL,   install_location = NULL,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose") )

title: Download OxCal — oxcal_install
text: install_url character string specifying url OxCal installed. install_location character string specifying directory extract OxCal files . created necessary (see utils::unzip()). verbose logical scalar: status updates displayed?

title: Download OxCal — oxcal_install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  plot(res) plot(res, likelihood = TRUE, posterior = FALSE) plot(res, likelihood = FALSE, posterior = TRUE) } # }

what: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
code: oxcal_parse(object)  # S4 method for class 'list' oxcal_parse(object)  # S4 method for class 'character' oxcal_parse(object)

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
text: object character string naming JavaScript file data read (list returned oxcal_execute()).

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  plot(res) plot(res, likelihood = TRUE, posterior = FALSE) plot(res, likelihood = FALSE, posterior = TRUE) } # }

title: Plot OxCal Output — plot
code: # S4 method for class 'OxCalOutput,missing' plot(   x,   likelihood = TRUE,   posterior = TRUE,   warnings = TRUE,   col.likelihood = "grey",   col.posterior = "blue",   lty.likelihood = "solid",   lty.posterior = "dashed",   main = NULL,   sub = NULL,   ann = graphics::par("ann"),   axes = TRUE,   frame.plot = FALSE,   panel.first = NULL,   panel.last = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot OxCal Output — plot
text: x OxCalOutput object. likelihood logical scalar: likelihood drawn? posterior logical scalar: posterior distribution drawn? warnings logical scalar: warnings plotted? col.likelihood, col.posterior character string specifying color density. lty.likelihood, lty.posterior character string numeric value specifying line type lines. main character string giving main title plot. sub character string giving subtitle plot. ann logical scalar: default annotation (title x, y z axis labels) appear plot? axes logical scalar: axes drawn plot? frame.plot logical scalar: box drawn around plot? panel.first expression evaluated plot axes set plotting takes place. can useful drawing background grids. panel.last expression evaluated plotting taken place axes, title box added. ... graphical parameters may also passed arguments function.

title: Plot OxCal Output — plot
text: plot() called side-effects: results graphic displayed. Invisibly returns x.

title: Plot OxCal Output — plot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Calibrate 14C dates cal <- oxcal_calibrate(   names = c("X","Y"),   dates = c(5000, 4500),   errors = c(45, 35) )  plot(cal) } # }
